174.article_body: A 17-year-old girl died after falling off the balcony of her 14th-floor flat in Hadapsar area of Pune, police said. The incident appeared to be a case of suicide after a preliminary probe, police added. "The reason is not clear and no suicide note has been found...She was alone at home at the time of death," an officer said.

175.title: Hindu outfits hold 'Sankalp March' in Delhi, traffic advisory issued
175.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of a 'Sankalp March' organised by various Hindu outfits on Saturday, against "attacks on the community". Several roads in central Delhi have been closed temporarily due to the march, reports stated. To facilitate smooth flow of traffic, only pedestrians have been allowed on at least nine important roads till 2 pm.

176.title: I'm worried about it: Manjrekar on Hardik bowling 10 overs in ODIs
176.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he is "worried" about Hardik Pandya bowling 10 overs in ODIs. "[ODI] cricket for an all-rounder is tough, it really takes a lot out of you...It is physically very draining," added Manjrekar. "Kapil Dev...[would]...confess that...[batting] first...[running] those hard singles and...then [coming] in to bowl another spell...was a very demanding task," he stated.

177.title: BJP wants to finish Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
177.article_body: Shiv Sena's Member of Parliament (MP) Sanjay Raut on Friday accused the BJP of trying to destroy Shiv Sena. "BJP doesn't want to engineer a split in the Shiv Sena, but it wants to finish the party," he said. "Till the time Shiv Sena exists, they cannot realise their dream of breaking Maharashtra into three pieces," he added.

178.title: Protestors enter Sri Lanka Presidential palace amid economic crisis; video surfaces
178.article_body: Protestors in Sri Lanka's commercial capital Colombo broke through police barricades and entered the Presidential palace on Saturday in one of the largest anti-government marches in the crisis-hit country this year. Reports earlier said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after the protestors surrounded the palace. At least 21 people, including two policemen were injured and hospitalised.

179.title: 'Goodfellas', 'The Sopranos' actor Tony Sirico passes away at 79
179.article_body: Veteran American actor Tony Sirico, known for playing Paulie Walnuts in 'The Sopranos' and Tony Stacks in 'Goodfellas', passed away aged 79 on Friday. Sirico died at an assisted living facility in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, said his manager, Bob McGowen. Michael Imperioli, who portrayed Christopher Moltisanti on 'The Sopranos', mourned Sirico's demise, saying he will miss him forever.

180.title: Protesters ram tractor into barricades in H'yana; farmer killed, 4 hurt
180.article_body: A farmer was killed and four others, including three policemen, were injured after protesters allegedly rammed a tractor into the barricades outside Rajiv Gandhi Thermal Power Plant in Haryana's Hisar. The protesters, who've been staging a dharna for several weeks, demanded that the power plant shouldn't auction the fly ash it generates but rather give it to them as before.

181.title: Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' to be helmed by Julius Onah
181.article_body: The upcoming Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' will be directed by Julius Onah, known for 'The Girl is in Trouble' and 'The Cloverfield Paradox'. Malcolm Spellman, writer of 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier', is writing the screenplay with Dalan Musson. Marvel Studios is expected to announce the release date of 'Captain America 4' at San Diego Comic-Con this month.

182.title: It wasn't pleasant to see the whole stadium cheering for Norrie: Novak
182.article_body: Discussing his win against Cameron Norrie in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "It's never pleasant to have the whole stadium cheering for your opponent." "I sat down, wasn't...feeling well, but somehow...managed to turn the match around....It was not easy to close out the match...I felt a lot of pressure to serve it out," he added.

183.title: WWE founder paid ₹95 cr to 4 women to keep quiet about his sexual misconduct: Reports
183.article_body: WWE founder Vince McMahon paid more than $12 million (over ₹95 crore) to four different women to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity, reports stated. One of the four women was an ex-WWE wrestler, who alleged that McMahon had coerced her into giving him oral sex and then demoted her, the reports added. WWE's board is investigating the allegations.

184.title: I am the outcast among Australian players: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios
184.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios, who's reached the final of Wimbledon 2022, said he is the outcast among the Australian tennis players. "The...only great [Australian tennis player who's]...ever been supportive...[is] Lleyton Hewitt," added Kyrgios. Talking about being termed Wimbledon's "worst nightmare" in an article, Kyrgios stated, "It's hard. It's something that I have to deal with."

185.title: Govt standing behind private sector as partner in progress: PM Modi
185.article_body: Speaking at the first 'Arun Jaitley Memorial Lecture' in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said that the government is standing behind the private sector as a partner in progress. "Today, India is one of the most reliable and state-of-the-art space service providers in the world. Our private sector ecosystem is doing a great job in this area," PM Modi added.

186.title: I am only as old as you think I am: Mahindra after Twitter user asks his age
186.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday responded to a Twitter user who asked him his age. Mahindra wrote, "You could've found out via Google, so I suppose this is a philosophical question. In that spirit, my answer is that 'Age (like beauty) lies in the eyes of the beholder', so I'm only as old as you think I am."

187.title: Delhi man dies after assault; 1 killed in encounter; 3 arrested
187.article_body: A Delhi resident succumbed to his injuries sustained during an attack by five-six people in the city. The police arrested three people while one of the accused, Aakash (23), was shot dead during an encounter with the police in Delhi's New Usmanpur area. The other accused are identified as Vishal Negi (25), Monu (20) and Nikhil Dutt (19), police said.

188.title: Man arrested for smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 cr in suitcase rods in Hyderabad
188.article_body: A male passenger arriving from Dubai was arrested by customs officials at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad for allegedly smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 crore. According to officials, the accused tried to smuggle 2,290 grams of gold by concealing it in his suitcase's rods. He was arrested on Friday and sent to judicial custody.

189.title: Sri Lanka President runs away as protestors surround his residence: Reports
189.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after protestors surrounded his residence amid the economic crisis in the country. Protestors are demanding the resignation of Rajapaksa. Troops used tear gas and water cannons to push back demonstrators who breached the security barricades near the Presidential palace in the capital Colombo.

190.title: 4 arrested for robbing ₹56,000 from financial company in Delhi
190.article_body: Police arrested four men for allegedly robbing ₹56,000 from a non-banking financial company in Delhi's Preet Vihar area, police said. The accused also tried to rob gold articles but the branch manager pressed the security remote, which was kept in his pocket, police added. The accused fled from the spot after the security alarm started ringing loudly, police further said.

191.title: Rajnath Singh to launch 75 newly-made AI-enabled defence products
191.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will inaugurate the first-ever 'Artificial Intelligence in Defence' symposium and exhibition, by the Department of Defence Production, Ministry of Defence, on July 11. He will be launching 75 newly-developed defence products powered by AI at the event. The products are in the domains of robotics systems, intelligent monitoring system and cybersecurity, among others.

192.title: India to tour Aus twice in 2024-32 FTP cycle; Tests increased to 5: Reports
192.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly going to tour Australia twice in the upcoming 2024-2032 Future Tours Programme (FTP) cycle. According to reports, a five-match Test series will be held between the two nations in Australia instead of four. Notably, the reports claimed that Cricket Australia is expected to earn up to AU$300 million with the increase in matches.

193.title: Question is who'll Pant replace? Kishan or Karthik?: RP Singh on 2nd T20I
193.article_body: Discussing India's lineup for the second T20I against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh said, "The question is who'll Rishabh Pant replace? Ishan Kishan or Dinesh Karthik?" Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah, Ravindra Jadeja and Pant didn't feature in the opening T20I but will be available for the remaining T20Is. However, Zaheer Khan said he doesn't expect any changes in the lineup.

194.title: US Senator Warren calls for universal device chargers to reduce e-waste
194.article_body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren called for US to follow EU in standardising universal chargers for devices to reduce e-waste. In a letter to US' Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, Warren and two other senators highlighted how chargers account for 11,000 tons of e-waste annually. "We can clear things up with uniform standards...for less expense, less hassle, and less waste," Warren tweeted.

195.title: 35-yr-old man lynched for allegedly stealing iron rods in Odisha
195.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly lynched for stealing iron rods from a villager's prawn enclosure in Odisha's Balasore. According to police, the deceased had admitted to the theft when confronted and begged forgiveness. He had also returned the stolen rods to the owner. But he was tied to a tree in kangaroo court headed by the village sarpanch and assaulted.

196.title: Rohini Bhatia, wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia, quits board
196.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, said that Rohini Bhatia will resign from the board of directors of the company, with effect from July 11, 2022. Rohini is the wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia and she is the Chairperson of the CSR committee of the company.  She had joined the board in 2019.

197.title: Ford recalls 100,000 vehicles in US over potential fire hazard
197.article_body: Automobile manufacturer Ford has recalled 100,000 vehicles in the US over potential fire risks. The recall covers certain 2020-2022 units of Ford Escape, Maverick and Lincoln Corsair with hybrid engines that can catch fire in case of an engine failure, the company said. However, it added that the issue has caused no accidents or injuries so far.

198.title: SBI to open 1st exclusive branch for start-ups in Bengaluru
198.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) and Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), which would enable SBI to open India's first dedicated branch for startups. The facility called the 'SBI Startup Hub' branch will be located at Koramangala in Bengaluru. SBI will offer collateral-free financial assistance of up to ₹2 crore to start-up entrepreneurs.

199.title: 3 minor boys gangrape 15-year-old girl in Tamil Nadu, blackmail her with video
199.article_body: The police in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore has taken three minor boys into custody and booked them under POCSO Act for allegedly gangraping a 15-year-old girl. The accused also filmed the act on their mobile phones and threatened to circulate the clip if she revealed the incident to anyone. As per police, the juveniles circulated the clip to the victim's friend.

200.title: TIME magazine cover features Shinzo Abe
200.article_body: TIME magazine has unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition featuring former Japan PM Shinzo Abe who was assassinated during a speech in the Nara city. "Abe will be remembered for remaking Japan," TIME magazine said. After he was declared dead, medical officials said Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.

201.title: Adani Group to participate in 5G spectrum auction; to face Jio, Airtel: Report
201.article_body: The Adani Group has reportedly applied for participating in India’s first auction of 5G airwaves starting July 26. Three telecom operators- Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have submitted their applications while Adani's participation is yet to be independently confirmed. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of spectrum worth at least ₹4.3 lakh crore will be put for auction.

202.title: It was unfair, strange: Ribéry on Ronaldo winning 2013 Ballon d'Or over him
202.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo winning the Ballon d'Or in 2013 with him finishing third, French winger Franck Ribéry said, "It was unfair...I [should've] won it." "They extended the time for votes and something strange happened...It was a political choice," added Ribéry. "It was a difficult period, it was incomprehensible...For me, it was like a robbery," Ribéry had earlier stated.

203.title: Fire brigade rescues 6 people after part of house collapses in Pune
203.article_body: Fire brigade personnel rescued six residents of Karande Wada in Pune's Shukrawar Peth after a portion of a house collapsed on Saturday. A fire officer said that the structure is "80 to 90 years old", adding, "We suspect that incessant rains and...already dilapidated condition led to...collapse of this part." PMC's building department will inspect the structure, fire brigade officials said.

204.title: Red alert issued for 7 districts in K'taka amid heavy rains; 12 dead since June 1
204.article_body: Amid heavy rains, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada, Udupi, Chikkamagaluru, Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan districts. CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said a total of 12 people have lost their lives so far in various rain-related incidents since June 1. Karnataka has received 94% excess rain during July, according to IMD.

205.title: Be careful about period-tracking apps: WH official after abortion ruling
205.article_body: Director of the White House's Gender Policy Council Jen Klein has said that people in the US should be "really careful" about using period-tracking apps following the Supreme Court's latest ruling on abortion. She clarified the White House is not directing people to stop using the apps. Menstrual cycle tracking app Flo announced an 'anonymous mode' option last week.

206.title: It's very emotional for me: Ananya on Suhana & Shanaya's acting debuts
206.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said she's looking forward to seeing her best friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan make their debut in Bollywood. "Suhana, Shanaya and I have had this collective dream of being in showbiz. Growing up, all we did together was play acting games," Ananya said, adding, "So it's very exciting for me, it's very emotional for me."

207.title: 70-yr-old woman held captive by son in bathroom for 2 yrs in K'taka, freed
207.article_body: A 70-year-old woman, who had been held captive by her son and daughter-in-law in a bathroom at their home for over two years in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, has been freed, as per reports. The woman fell and was injured in January 2020, following which she was held captive and was not even provided food, a Senior Citizens' Helpline official said.

208.title: Steve Smith is a 'very harsh' critic of himself: Marnus Labuschagne
208.article_body: Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said Steve Smith is a "very harsh" critic of himself, adding that Smith's expectations are "really high". Smith once ran three kilometres back to the hotel after being dismissed cheaply. "I always punish myself when I get no runs," he had stated. Smith recently scored his 28th Test century marking his first ton in 18 months.

209.title: After being acquitted of murder, BJP leader holds roadshow in UP; booked
209.article_body: A BJP leader and his supporters were booked for allegedly holding a roadshow from Etah district jail to Aligarh in Uttar Pradesh without administration's permission. The roadshow was taken out on Thursday, a day after the BJP leader was acquitted of murdering a man during 2020 CAA-NRC protest. "There were around 30 to 35 vehicles in...procession," a police officer said.

210.title: India responded after Chinese jet came close to LAC in June: Reports
210.article_body: The Indian Air Force had responded as per the standard operating procedures after Chinese Air Force aircraft flew very close to the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Ladakh sector in the last week of June, reports said. The aircraft was spotted by men on ground and was also picked up by radars deployed in the border area, reports added.

211.title: Sale of machine made or polyester national flag exempt from GST: Govt
211.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that the sale of India's national flag, irrespective of whether it is machine-made or of polyester, is exempt from GST. Hand-woven, hand-spun national flags made of cotton, silk, wool or Khadi are already exempt from GST. After an amendment to the Flag Code of India, 2002, the tricolour can now be hand-made or machine-made.

212.title: If a top 5 batter bowls in powerplay, it's like having 12 players: Parthiv
212.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said he feels that a team is playing with 12 players if there's a batter in the top five who can bowl in the powerplay. Hardik Pandya recently picked four wickets in the first T20I against England. Bhuvneshwar Kumar conceded 10 runs and picked one wicket. "When there's swing...there is none better than Bhuvneshwar," added Parthiv.

213.title: A stampede-like situation happened: Rescued Amarnath pilgrim on cloudburst
213.article_body: "A stampede-like situation happened there," said a pilgrim who was rescued from the Amarnath cave following a cloudburst. "The floods triggered by the cloudburst carried a large number of stones with it," an eyewitness said. "We all had a harrowing experience as we witnessed people and bags get swept away with the water," another rescued pilgrim added.

214.title: Boris Johnson's wax statue placed outside 'find a job' centre after he resigns as UK PM
214.article_body: A wax figure of Boris Johnson has appeared outside a 'find a job' centre after he resigned as the UK PM. Members of the public have been spotted posing for photos with the waxwork, from Madame Tussauds in Blackpool. Johnson will continue to serve as Prime Minister until the Conservative Party chooses his successor.

215.title: Messi threatens to leave PSG if the club signs Ronaldo: Reports
215.article_body: PSG forward Lionel Messi has threatened to leave PSG if the club signs Cristiano Ronaldo from Manchester United, reports stated. Messi reportedly told PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi that he'll return to Barcelona in case the club signs Ronaldo. Ronaldo is believed to be looking for transfer from Manchester United as the club failed to qualify for the upcoming Champions League.

216.title: US President pens note for Shinzo Abe at Japan embassy; pic surfaces
216.article_body: US President Joe Biden visited Japanese Ambassador to the US, Koji Tomita, and offered his condolences after the assassination of Shinzo Abe. Biden penned a note for the former Japanese PM and wrote, "I had the honour to get to know Abe when I hosted him at the Vice President's residence and when I met with him in Japan."

217.title: I've more tolerance for bullshit now: Taapsee on completing 12 yrs in industry
217.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who has completed 12 years in the industry, spoke about how she has changed over the years and said that she has become a very different person from what she was in the beginning. She added that she has "a lot more tolerance for bullshit now". "I've...calmed down a lot from what I was before," said Taapsee.

218.title: Musical.ly co-founder quits TikTok-parent ByteDance: Report
218.article_body: Lip-sync video app Musical.ly Co-founder Louis Yang left China's ByteDance last week following the failure of an edtech project due to a regulatory crackdown on online tutoring services and apps, Bloomberg reported citing a source. Yang was last in charge of ByteDance's foray into educational gadgets. Musical.ly was acquired by ByteDance and got absorbed into TikTok.

219.title: 23-year-old man killed following verbal spat in Pune; 4 arrested
219.article_body: Four people were arrested for allegedly killing a 23-year-old man following a verbal spat with one of them in Pune, according to police. One of the accused had reportedly knifed the deceased in the stomach. The deceased had also called his friends and had been searching for one of the accused with the intention of physical assault.

220.title: Uttarakhand HC permits animal slaughter on Bakri Eid in Haridwar
220.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday permitted animal slaughter in Haridwar district during the Bakri Eid festival. HC directed that the animals should be slaughtered only at a "legally compliant" slaughterhouse and not on roads. The state government, in March 2021, had imposed a blanket ban on all animal slaughter in Haridwar ahead of the Kumbh Mela.

221.title: Shoppers Stop announces flat 50% off on over 500 brands
221.article_body: Shoppers Stop, a fashion & beauty destination has announced flat 50% off on over 500 brands. Revamp your wardrobe with stylish options available at great deals across categories like watches, fragrances, apparel, footwear and more, the brand stated. Additionally, users of HDFC Bank cards and First Citizen Citibank credit cards can avail up to 10% instant discount* and 10% cashback*.

222.title: Planning to increase childcare benefits at my firms: Elon Musk
222.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Friday said that he plans to "significantly" increase childcare benefits at his companies. Musk, who is now a father of nine children, while replying to a tweet seeking advice to those who don't have children "for cost reasons", said, "Kids are worth it...Also, Musk Foundation plans to donate directly to families."

223.title: Teen kills 80-yr-old grandmother for not giving him money in Delhi
223.article_body: A 17-year-old boy reportedly killed his 80-year-old grandmother in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh area for not giving him money. According to police, the accused entered the flat where the deceased had been living alone for over a year on Thursday. He demanded money from her and when she refused, he slit her throat using a blade, police said.

224.title: Rogers network recovering after 19-hr outage hits millions in Canada
224.article_body: Canadian telecom provider Rogers' network has started recovering after it suffered a major 19-hour service outage that affected millions in Canada. The outage affected banking services, internet access, cell phone and landline phone connections, with some people reporting not being able to connect to 911 calls. Rogers CEO Tony Staffieri apologised for the outage, saying, "Today we let you down."

225.title: Sachin Pilot meets family of tailor killed in Udaipur; shares pics
225.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Friday met the family members of tailor Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur for allegedly supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. He also shared pictures of the meeting. Calling the incident a "barbaric massacre", he added that the "pain and anguish" that Kanhaiya's family is going through can't be expressed in words.

226.title: Picking Bumrah as captain for 5th Test was the biggest mistake: Ghavri
226.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Karsan Ghavri said the BCCI made their "biggest mistake" by picking Jasprit Bumrah as captain for the fifth Test against England. Ghavri added that Virat Kohli should have led the team. "Batting, bowling, bowling changes, fielding and field placement – everything was a concern," stated Ghavri. He said the decision to not pick Ravichandran Ashwin was "totally wrong".

227.title: Alt News was only enabled to receive domestic payments: Razorpay
227.article_body: Razorpay CEO Harshil Mathur released a statement in connection with donations received by Alt News. While the Delhi Police alleged that Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair received donations from foreign nations, Mathur stated that only domestic payments were enabled for them and foreign transactions weren't allowed without FCRA approval. Razorpay temporarily disabled their account, he added.

228.title: Over 72,000 startups have created 7.5 lakh jobs in India: Govt data
228.article_body: The latest data released by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) showed that the number of officially recognised startups in India has risen to 72,000, and they have also created 7.5 lakh jobs in the country. Out of these, over 45% have at least one woman director. Around 11 jobs were created by each startup.

229.title: GoM to finalise report on levying 28% GST on online gaming next week
229.article_body: The Group of Ministers (GoM) will meet on Tuesday to finalise report on GST slab for online gaming, horse racing and casinos. Online games, where no betting or gambling is involved, are currently under 18% GST slab but GoM in May had proposed imposing 28% GST. GST Council had asked ministers to review and finalise the report by July 15.

230.title: Alia wraps 'Heart of Stone' shoot, Gal Gadot calls her 'amazing talent'
230.article_body: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to share that she has wrapped up the shoot for her debut Hollywood film, 'Heart of Stone' where she'll share screen space with Gal Gadot and Jamie Dornan. Gadot shared a picture with Alia on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Give some love to my girl...who wrapped on #HeartOfStone. Such an amazing talent and...a great person."

231.title: My competition is not with people of my age, it's with youngsters: Anupam
231.article_body: Anupam Kher opened up about his fitness and what keeps him motivated and said, "Unless you make yourself uncomfortable...how will you inspire...others?" He added his competition isn't with the people of his age, it's with the youngsters. The 67-year-old actor further said he feels he has just reached the interval of his career, adding, "I still have...20-25 years of work...[left]."

232.title: India reports 18,840 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,25,028
232.article_body: India has reported 18,840 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,815 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,25,028, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,386, according to the latest data.

233.title: What reasons did Elon Musk give for ending the $44 billion Twitter deal?
233.article_body: Apart from citing the lack of information regarding fake accounts, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers stated the insufficient data on financial condition, recent layoffs and hiring freeze by Twitter as reasons for ending the deal. The filing said Twitter fired two high-level employees and one-third of its talent acquisition team, breaching its obligation to preserve company's material components.

234.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
234.article_body: The IMD has stated that fairly widespread/widespread rainfall with isolated heavy rainfall is very likely over Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka during next 5 days. It added that extremely heavy rainfall is likely over Goa during next five days. Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh may witness heavy rainfall until July 12.

235.title: Japan releases statement after Shinzo Abe's death
235.article_body: Japan Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has released a statement after the death of former PM Shinzo Abe. "The despicable act that took the life of Mr Abe Shinzo...is absolutely intolerable, and I condemn it in the strongest possible terms," he said. Kishida further said that Abe "possessed outstanding leadership and execution ability". "I cannot hold back my grief," he added.

236.title: 25 buildings to be self-demolished in Mumbai's Sion-Koliwada
236.article_body: After an eight-year-long battle between the residents and BMC, 25 buildings at Guru Tegh Bahadur (GTB) Nagar in Sion-Koliwada will be self-demolished starting Monday. BMC had declared the buildings that once housed 1,200 families dangerous for habitation by placing them under the C-1 category in 2014. At the beginning of 2022, the BMC disconnected their electricity and water supply.

237.title: Death toll rises to 15 in Amarnath cloudburst; 15,000 people moved to safety
237.article_body: The death toll due to the cloudburst near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir has risen to 15, Indian Army officials said. About 15,000 people have been safely shifted so far, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) added. "Most of the pilgrims who were stranded near holy cave area due to flash flood last evening [have been] shifted to Panjtarni," ITBP stated.

238.title: If Ashwin can be dropped from Tests, why can't Kohli be dropped from T20Is: Kapil Dev
238.article_body: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev suggested that Virat Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side as he is not batting at the level he should be performing. He further asked that if Ravichandran Ashwin can be dropped from Tests, why Kohli can't be dropped from T20Is. The second England-India T20I to take place today.

239.title: 'Alaska is ours' billboards seen in Russia after it threatened to 'take it back' from US
239.article_body: After Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets over Ukraine invasion, billboards reading "Alaska is ours" surfaced in Russia's Krasnoyarsk. A company named Alaska claimed responsibility for the billboards and said that its director was "very patriotic".

240.title: Pune airport's multilevel parking facility to be ready by Oct: Official
240.article_body: The construction work of Pune airport's multilevel parking facility is expected to be finished by October this year. "Around 90% of work is completed. The delivery of few items like escalators and elevators, bought from foreign countries, is delayed," said Santosh Dhoke, Director, Pune airport. Notably, the project's cost is ₹120 crore and will be able to accommodate 1,000 cars.

241.title: Twitter got busted for spam accounts: Trump's son on Musk ending deal
241.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's son Donald Trump Jr took to Twitter to comment on Elon Musk ending his $44-billion Twitter deal and said, "So basically Twitter has a huge amount of spam accounts...and has gotten busted for it!!!" "As I said weeks ago spam accounts are probably 50% not 5% of Twitter users," he added.

242.title: The faster the bowler, the more easily Suryakumar plays him: Ajay Jadeja
242.article_body: Talking about Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said, "The faster the bowler comes, the more easily he plays him...He goes inside the line against...[pacers] and uses their pace." Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar stated Suryakumar can play 10-15 different types of sweep shots and cover drives. "Some of the shots he plays [leave] you astonished," added Manjrekar.

243.title: US man gets arrested for selling thousands of fake Cisco equipment
243.article_body: A 38-year-old US man was arrested by authorities for allegedly procuring fake Cisco equipment from suppliers in China and Hong Kong and selling them on platforms like Amazon and eBay. Onur Aksoy sold products that if authentic would be worth more than $1 billion. He imported tens of thousands of fake devices through at least 19 entities from 2013-2022.

244.title: Work on Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train corridor to begin soon: Dy CM Fadnavis
244.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that work on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train corridor will start soon. "For certain reasons, Maharashtra remained behind while Gujarat worked swiftly for the bullet train," he said. "We've decided to catch up because it is not just a bullet train but the beginning of a new phase of transportation," he added.

245.title: Pune city has recorded a 44.38% rain deficit till now: IMD
245.article_body: Pune city has recorded a rain deficit of 44.38% between June 1 and July 8, an India Meteorological Department official said. The city still has a deficit of 82.8 mm as the normal rainfall was reported at 104.1 mm, the official added. On Friday, Shivajinagar reported 3.1 mm, Pashan reported 4 mm and Chinchwad reported 1.5 mm rainfall.

246.title: G-20 ministers fail to reach common ground on Russia-Ukraine war
246.article_body: The G-20 Foreign Ministers Summit in Bali, Indonesia, on Friday failed to develop consensus on the Russia-Ukraine war and its ramifications. Russian Minister Sergey Lavrov walked out of the statements delivered by Germany and Ukraine. The divisive atmosphere was evident as the traditional group photo of the ministers was not taken, neither was a joint, final communique issued.

247.title: After complaint, B'luru police says it will clear parked tractor
247.article_body: Following a complaint about a parked tractor by a Twitter user, Bengaluru's HSR Layout Traffic Police Station on Friday said that the unauthorised parking of the vehicle will be cleared. "Can this tractor be removed, it's parked here from Stone Age," the Twitter user had said. The traffic police also thanked the Twitter user for the information.

248.title: Man who killed wife found dead in jail in Pune; suicide suspected
248.article_body: A man who was lodged at Pune's Yerwada Central Prison after he allegedly murdered his wife was found hanging from a tree on the prison's premises. Prima facie, it is suspected that the accused died by suicide. The jail's staff found that the undertrial was missing during a routine check on Thursday afternoon and then later found the body.

249.title: Tribal woman who was set on fire by 3 men over land dispute in MP dies
249.article_body: A 38-year-old tribal woman, who was allegedly set on fire by three men over a land dispute in Madhya Pradesh's Guna on July 2, died on Friday, police said. While two of the accused have been arrested, a search is ongoing for the third accused, police added. The woman's husband claimed that the accused had forcibly taken his land.

250.title: Tesla crash that killed 66-yr-old driver, passenger under probe in US
250.article_body: The US NHTSA will open a special investigation into a Tesla crash that killed a 66-year-old Tesla driver and a 67-year-old passenger in Florida. Both the people were pronounced dead at the accident scene after a Tesla rear-ended a parked tractor-trailer in the Gainesville area at a rest area. It is reportedly unclear if Tesla's Autopilot was in use.

251.title: Will pursue legal action to enforce merger: Twitter after Musk ends $44 billion deal
251.article_body: Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor has said that the board plans to pursue legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he pulled out of the $44 billion deal. Taylor tweeted, "The Twitter Board is committed to closing the transaction on the price and terms agreed upon with Musk and plans to pursue legal action to enforce the merger agreement."

252.title: Jadeja deletes posts related to CSK from his Instagram account, sparks rumours of rift
252.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja deleted posts related to CSK from his Instagram account, sparking rumours of rift between him and the franchise. "The management needs to talk to Jadeja about what's the problem," a fan reacted. "Something is definitely not right," wrote another. Jadeja was named CSK captain for 2022 season, however, he stepped down in the middle of the tournament.

253.title: 28-yr-old man, denied food after b'day party, stabs 4 women in Delhi
253.article_body: A 28-year-old drunk man who was denied food after a birthday party allegedly stabbed three sisters and their mother in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. The incident took place following the birthday party of a five-year-old when around midnight, the accused took out a knife and stabbed the victims. A case of attempt to murder has been registered, police added.

254.title: Biden mistakenly reads part on teleprompter that says 'repeat the line'; video viral
254.article_body: A video showing US President Joe Biden reading a part on teleprompter that said "repeat the line" has gone viral on social media. Biden appeared unaware as to what and what not to read out loud from the teleprompter. Reacting to the video, Elon Musk tweeted, "Whoever controls the teleprompter is the real President!"

255.title: Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal to buy Twitter over breach of agreement
255.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that he was terminating his $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter, alleging multiple breaches of the agreement. In a filing, Musk’s lawyers said Twitter had failed to respond to multiple requests for information on fake or spam accounts on the platform, which was fundamental to the company's performance.

256.title: Further sanctions may cause 'catastrophic' rise in gas price: Putin
256.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that further sanctions against Russia could lead to "catastrophic" price rise in the global energy market. He said Europe's attempt to replace Russian energy resources would expectedly result in an increase in spot price of gas. He also said, "Sanctions...on Russia cause much more damage to those countries that impose them."

257.title: Woman living in India since 1966 moves Bombay HC for citizenship
257.article_body: A 67-year-old woman who has been living in Mumbai since 1966 has filed a petition before Bombay HC seeking directions to the Centre to grant her Indian citizenship. Ila Popat's advocate informed a division bench that she was born in Uganda to Indian-origin parents with British passports. He added that Ila came to India on her mother's passport in 1966.

258.title: Man gets first prison term for anti-war remarks in Russia
258.article_body: In a first, a Russian court on Friday awarded seven years of imprisonment to a member of a Moscow municipal council for spreading "false information" about the war in Ukraine. The first two convictions under the law led to a fine and a suspended sentence, according to a legal aid group. The law was passed after Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

259.title: 2 killed, 5 injured after landslide in Manipur
259.article_body: Two people were killed and five were wounded after the vehicle they were travelling got swept away into a gorge by a landslide that hit NH 102 in Manipur's Churachandpur district on Friday, police said. The landslide hit just after the passengers of the vehicle cleared the debris and tree branches that were blocking the vehicle's path, police added.

260.title: Indian official inaugurates Nepal school building built with Indian aid
260.article_body: First Secretary of Indian embassy, Karun Bansal, on Friday inaugurated the third building of a secondary school in Nepal's Kapilvastu district. The building was constructed with grant assistance from the Indian government at a cost of ₹2.12 crore, an embassy release said. This is one of the projects being inaugurated under the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, the release added.

261.title: Curtain used to separate male, female students in Kerala for Gender Politics class
261.article_body: A photo shared on social media shows male and female students of a government medical college in Thrissur, Kerala, attending a class with a curtain separating both the genders. Topic of the class was on sensitising the students on 'Gender Politics'. As the incident garnered criticism, the students' union of the college said the class wasn't held on its campus.

262.title: Milind Soman-starrer 'Captain Vyom' to make comeback with reboot
262.article_body: Filmmaker Ketan Mehta has announced that Milind Soman-starrer science-fiction superhero show 'Captain Vyom' will make a comeback with a new-age reboot. "Captain Vyom is an Indian-origin superhero for a global audience. And it's time to reinvent when India is dreaming of its space in the new century," Ketan said. The television show aired on Doordarshan in the late 1990s.

263.title: Akshay Kumar's first look from new film leaked, pic goes viral
263.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar's first look as mining engineer Jaswant Singh Gill from his upcoming film has been leaked. The picture, which is going viral on social media, shows Akshay wearing a turban in a field reported to be in UK's Yorkshire. The film is being referred to as 'Capsule Gill', however, the producers have not announced the title yet.

264.title: Banking, internet services disrupted in Canada as Rogers faces network outage
264.article_body: A major outage of Canadian telecom provider Rogers' mobile and internet networks on Friday disrupted banking services across the country. "Our technical teams are working hard to restore services as quickly as possible," the firm said on Twitter. This is the second major outage to hit one of the biggest telecom providers in Canada in 15 months.

265.title: Extend support to NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiv Sena MP to Uddhav
265.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Rajendra Gavit has urged party chief Uddhav Thackeray to support Droupadi Murmu's candidature in the Presidential election. Gavit, who belongs to a tribal community, is the second Sena MP to suggest that the party back NDA's Presidential candidate. It would be an honour if a tribal person became the President, Gavit said in a letter to Thackeray.

266.title: Have spoken to J&K LG: Shah after cloudburst near Amarnath cave
266.article_body: After a cloudburst was reported near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir, Union Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, saying he has spoken to LG Manoj Sinha to take stock of the situation. "Our priority is to save the lives of people," Shah tweeted. NDRF, SDRF, BSF and the local administration are involved in rescue operations, he added.

267.title: Shinzo Abe's assassin said he used handmade gun: Japanese Police
267.article_body: Japanese Police on Friday said the assassin of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe told officers that he had used a handmade gun. "That's the suspect's assertion, and we have determined that (the gun) is clearly handmade in appearance, although our analysis is currently ongoing," a police officer said. Investigators found several other handmade guns at his one-room flat, police added.

268.title: I really did want Wimbledon semis match: Kyrgios after Nadal's withdrawal
268.article_body: After reaching his maiden Grand Slam final at Wimbledon following Rafael Nadal's withdrawal on the eve of their semi-final match due to an abdominal injury, unseeded Nick Kyrgios said, "As a competitor, I really did want that match." He added that he was hoping for a "third chapter" after going 1-1 in two previous matches against Nadal at Wimbledon.

269.title: Djokovic becomes 2nd male player in Open Era with most wins at Wimbledon
269.article_body: Three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic surpassed Jimmy Connors and is the second male player behind Roger Federer(105) in the Open Era with most wins at Wimbledon following his 85th win on Friday. The top seed defeated ninth seed Cameron Norrie 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 in the semi-final. It is Djokovic's 27th straight win at the grass-court Grand Slam.

270.title: Without inclusion, real growth is not possible: PM Modi
270.article_body: Speaking at the first 'Arun Jaitley Memorial Lecture' in Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that real growth is not possible without inclusive growth. "Today's India is preparing a roadmap for the coming 25 years with reforms by conviction rather than reforms by compulsion," PM Modi said. "Our policy-making is based on the pulse of the people," he added.

271.title: UK Opposition leaders get clean chit in 'beergate' incident
271.article_body: UK police on Friday said top Opposition leaders, Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner, would not be fined in the "beergate" incident, where the two were found drinking in a closed setting in northeast England last year. At the time, rules forbade indoor social mixing between households. The police concluded the interaction was an "exception" as part of a workday.

272.title: Mexico accuses former president Peña Nieto of managing illicit funds
272.article_body: Mexico’s anti-money laundering agency has accused ex-President Enrique Peña Nieto of managing millions of dollars in illicit funds. This is the first formal legal accusation against Nieto whose term in office from 2012 to 2018 was clouded by reports of corruption. Though a criminal complaint has been filed against Nieto by the government, prosecutors are yet to file formal charges.

273.title: Over 900 firefighters battle forest fire in southeastern France
273.article_body: Over 900 firefighters supported by water-showering planes battled a forest fire in southeastern France on Friday. In total, 18 firemen have sustained injuries in the operation and more than 1,500 acres of forest land has already been burnt. Officials said drought conditions and winds have strained efforts to contain the blaze as nearby villages were evacuated and highways were closed.

274.title: I told SRK he is the person every B'wood outsider looks up to: Taapsee
274.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that she told Shah Rukh Khan that he is the person every outsider trying to make it in Bollywood looks up to. "His victories are personal, his loss is personal, that is stardom for me...Not what we feel [a] star is," the actress added. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Dunki'.

275.title: Investor Burry takes a dig at Musk, says 'More babies in broken families not the way'
275.article_body: American investor Michael Burry took a dig at Tesla CEO Elon Musk after reports claimed he welcomed twins with a top Neuralink executive last year. "Babies born in...US are at 1950 levels, but that doesn't mean that bosses should sleep with subordinates to try to remedy the situation," Burry tweeted. "More babies in broken families not the way," he added.

276.title: 4 killed, several critical after consuming spurious liquor in West Bengal
276.article_body: Four died and several others were critical after consuming spurious liquor in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman. The administration and Excise Department had asked to keep all liquor shops closed until further orders. ADG Western Zone Sanjoy Singh and West Burdwan Police Superintendent Kamanasish Sen on Friday reportedly searched the area for spurious liquor shops.

277.title: Govt releases helpline numbers after 13 killed in Amarnath cloudburst
277.article_body: The government has released emergency helpline numbers in view of the cloudburst that happened today in the lower reaches of the Amarnath cave in J&K. At least 13 people were dead and three dozen were missing after a cloudburst triggered flash floods. PM Narendra Modi, while condoling the incident, tweeted, "Anguished by the cloudburst...Condolences to the bereaved families."

278.title: Rishi Kapoor used to called me a 'veteran actor': Taapsee Pannu
278.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor used to call her a "veteran actor" after he got to know that she did over 10 films in the south film industry. "Initially when I met him, the first thing he said was, 'What kind of name is this, Taapsee?' in jest," the actress added.

279.title: 20-year-old woman held for plotting father's murder with boyfriend
279.article_body: A 20-year-old woman and her boyfriend have been arrested in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district for their alleged involvement in planning the murder of the former's father, police said. Kanhaiya Singh, a businessman, was shot dead by unknown assailants on June 29. According to the police, Singh's daughter Aparna conspired to kill him as he opposed her relationship with her boyfriend.

280.title: Djokovic beats Norrie in Wimbledon semi-final, reaches his 32nd Grand Slam final
280.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic defeated Cameron Norrie in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles semi-final to reach his 32nd Grand Slam final. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 in two hours and 35 minutes. Djokovic will face Nick Kyrgios in the final on Sunday.

281.title: Decide on Vivo's request to operate bank accounts: Delhi HC to ED
281.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to consider Vivo India's representation seeking permission to use its frozen bank accounts by July 13. The Chinese mobile manufacturer approached the court after ED raided 48 locations belonging to Vivo across the country. Representing the ED, advocate Zoheb Hossain opposed Vivo's plea, saying the petition is premature.

282.title: Govt has fulfilled 95% of promises made before 2019 polls: Andhra CM
282.article_body: YSR Congress President and Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday said that his government has fulfilled 95% of the promises made ahead of the 2019 elections. Speaking at the YSRCP's plenary in Amaravati, Jagan Reddy claimed that his government has shown how an administration can be run in a transparent and a corruption-free manner.

283.title: Mexico to stay neutral on war in Ukraine: Obrador ahead of visit to US
283.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Friday said that his administration would maintain its neutral stance on the conflict between Russia and Ukraine. Obrador also said that he hoped there would be a ceasefire. Obrador's comments come ahead of his visit to the US to meet President Joe Biden next week.

284.title: Samsung working to prevent state-level cyberattacks: Senior exec
284.article_body: Samsung is working with Google and Microsoft to prevent state-level cyberattacks, Samsung Electronics Vice President Dr Seungwon Shin told Financial Express. "We...recognise that there are a large number of state-level cyberattacks...being launched," he said. "As long as [users] use the basic features...on our phones...we will be able to prevent...[phishing] attacks," Dr Shin added.

285.title: NC set to fight a multi-front battle in J&K: Farooq Abdullah
285.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Friday said that the party is set to fight a multi-front battle in the Union Territory. "On one front, we have to strive for an atmosphere, where...development and job creation are addressed," Abdullah said. "It (NC) has to keep up its peaceful and constitutional fight for...restoration of people's abridged rights," he added.

286.title: Former Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos dies
286.article_body: José Eduardo dos Santos, who served as the Angolan President for almost four decades till 2017, died at a clinic in Barcelona, Spain on Friday, following a long illness. He was 79. During his tenure Angola became one of the world's largest oil producers, even though the country remained poor and was riddled with corruption.

287.title: India to tour Zimbabwe for three ODIs after six years: Reports
287.article_body: India will tour Zimbabwe for a three-match ODI series next month, as per reports. The three matches will be a part of the ICC ODI Super League and will take place on August 18, 20 and 22, Cricbuzz reported. It will be India's first tour to Zimbabwe in six years. The matches will reportedly take place in Harare.

288.title: 31 students of govt school in Tamil Nadu test positive for COVID-19
288.article_body: At least 31 students of a government school in Andipatti of the Theni district in Tamil Nadu have tested positive for COVID-19, ANI reported on Friday. Apart from the students, 10 parents have also tested positive for the virus. The district education department has temporarily closed the school, while initiatives to sanitise the school have been started.

289.title: Four persons die of electrocution in Maharashtra's Aurangabad
289.article_body: Police said that four persons died after being electrocuted in a village in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district on Friday. All four victims suffered severe electric shocks and died on the spot. The incident took place around 3 pm in the village where work on providing new electricity connection was going on, the police added.

290.title: Hardik should bat in top 5 in any white-ball format: Vaughan
290.article_body: Michael Vaughan lauded Hardik Pandya following his 51(33) in first T20I against England, saying the India all-rounder should bat in the top five in any white-ball format. "If he bats in...top five then it gives so much depth as India can then play an extra batter...pacer or spinner depending on conditions," he added. Hardik batted at number five in Southampton.

291.title: 50 bovines die of suffocation after being locked in J'khand building
291.article_body: Nearly 50 bovines died of suffocation after being locked in a room of an abandoned school building in Jharkhand's Pakur district, the police said. "There were two windows in the room, but both were closed. There was no ventilation," Block Animal Husbandry Officer Farhat Jabbar said. Notably, villagers have been keeping their bovines in the building for years, officials said.

292.title: Chinese forces hold military drills as US Senator visits Taiwan
292.article_body: Chinese forces on Friday held military drills around the Taiwan Strait, PLA's Eastern Theater Command said. The drills come at the same time as US Senator Rick Scott's three-day Taiwan visit during which he is expected to meet President Tsai Ing-wen. A top Chinese general on Thursday had asked the US to cease military "collusion" with Taiwan.

293.title: JEE Main results to be out by July 10: Official
293.article_body: Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main 2022 session 1 results will be announced by July 10 and will be available on jeemain.nta.nic.in, an official said. In this year's B.E/B.Tech. (paper I) answer key, four questions have been dropped. JEE Main 2022 was held online this year from June 23 to 29 across over 500 centres in India and abroad.

294.title: Former TN minister R Kamaraj booked in disproportionate assets case
294.article_body: Tamil Nadu legislator and former Food and Civil Supplies Minister R Kamaraj was booked in a disproportionate assets case on Friday, for allegedly amassing ₹58 crore beyond known sources of income. Anti-corruption officials raided 49 locations associated to Kamaraj, including his residences in Thiruvarur and Chennai. Kamaraj's two sons and three associates have also been booked in the case.

295.title: Thousands of people visit Kerala's Lulu malls amid 'midnight sale', pics go viral
295.article_body: In a bid to renew 'nightlife shopping', Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala had announced midnight sales. Videos and photos of people visiting their outlets in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram in huge numbers have surfaced online. A video also showed a confrontation between a crowd of shoppers and the mall's security staff.

296.title: J&K LG cancels SI recruitment drive, recommends CBI probe
296.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Friday cancelled the recruitment drive for police sub-inspectors in the state and recommended a CBI investigation into the allegations of irregularities in the selection process. "Govt will soon decide future course of action for fresh recruitment," he said in a tweet. Sinha had ordered a probe into the allegations on June 9.

297.title: Video of Ganguly dancing near London Eye to celebrate 50th birthday goes viral
297.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Sourav Ganguly dancing near the London Eye to celebrate his 50th birthday. In the video, Ganguly can be seen dancing with his friends and family, while his daughter Sana can be seen sitting. "Sana is so embarrassed," someone can be heard saying in the video.

298.title: Don't know how India lost it: Sourav Ganguly on Edgbaston Test
298.article_body: Reacting to India's seven-wicket defeat against England in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know how India lost that game." India had set a target of 378 runs, which England chased in 76.4 overs. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow smashed hundreds in the fourth innings to help England win.

299.title: AAP leader booked for assault in Chandigarh
299.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party ward councillor in Chandigarh has been booked for allegedly assaulting a private contractor and his driver. According to the police complaint, Councillor Ram Chander Yadav attacked contractor Pardeep Bansal after the latter demanded payment for furniture work done at Ward 15 Community Centre. Yadav denied the charge, saying the police was working for the BJP.

300.title: Stunned, outraged & deeply saddened: Biden on Abe's assassination
300.article_body: Reacting to the assassination of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, US President Joe Biden on Friday said, "I am stunned, outraged, and deeply saddened by the news." "This is a tragedy for Japan and for all who knew him," he added. "His vision of a free and open Indo-Pacific will endure," he further said.

301.title: Ranveer Singh's '83' to be felicitated at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
301.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' will be felicitated at the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. Former Indian skipper Kapil Dev, who is portrayed by Ranveer in the film, will be the guest of honour at the festival. The festival was held virtually for the last two years but will make a physical comeback this year with both in-person and online programs.

302.title: After 4-year gap, Dalai Lama to visit Leh on July 15
302.article_body: The Dalai Lama will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on July 15, amidst deteriorating ties between India and China over the eastern Ladakh military standoff. Beijing has repeatedly objected to the Tibetan leader’s visit to the region. The Dalai Lama, 87, will impart teachings and is expected to stay for about a month in Leh.

303.title: Man arrested for selling fake high security number plates in Chandigarh
303.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly selling illegal high security number plates in Chandigarh's Sector 38, officials said. The accused, Tushar Aggarwal, a resident of Sector 41, was sent to two days of police custody on Thursday. Officials said fake high security number plates of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal and Chandigarh were seized from the accused.

304.title: Flood warning in Karnataka's Belagavi, Bagalkote districts amid heavy rains
304.article_body: Flood warnings have been sounded in Bagalkote and Belagavi districts of Karnataka due to heavy rainfall in neighbouring Maharashtra. "Owing to heavy rains in Maharashtra, water discharge by the neighbouring state into the Krishna river and its tributaries has increased," Karnataka Water Resources Minister Govind Karjol said. The inflow into Almatti Dam has crossed 75,200 cusecs, he added.

305.title: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak announces candidacy for UK Prime Minister
305.article_body: The UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday announced that he's standing to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and UK's Prime Minister. "Someone has to grip this moment and make the right decisions," Sunak said. The development comes a day after Boris Johnson resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership.

306.title: PM Modi pens tribute for Shinzo Abe, says 'We mourn his passing as one of our own'
306.article_body: PM Narendra Modi penned a heartfelt tribute for Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe following his assassination on Friday. "I first met him in 2007...Right from that first meeting, our friendship went beyond...the shackles of official protocol," he wrote. He added, "We in India mourn his passing as one of our own, just as he embraced us with an open heart."

307.title: Anguished: PM Modi after cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 10
307.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish after a cloudburst was reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. PM Modi also spoke to J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and took stock of the situation. "All possible assistance is being provided to the affected," he said on Twitter. Ten deaths have been reported in the incident.

308.title: India has lost a great friend: Kangana, Anupam condole Shinzo Abe's demise
308.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to condole former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's demise. She wrote, "Sad day. India lost a great friend. Om Shanti." Veteran actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Deeply saddened & shocked by the assassination of former PM of Japan #ShinzoAbe! He was one of the most compassionate world leaders! And a great friend of India!"

309.title: He is the best spinner in the world right now: Swann on Chahal
309.article_body: Speaking about Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-England spinner Graeme Swann stated the 31-year-old Indian is the best spinner in the world right now. "In T20 cricket, I think it's absolutely unarguable, he  absolutely is," he added. Chahal posted bowling figures of 4-0-32-2 against England in the first T20I in Southampton. The visitors defeated England by 50 runs on Thursday.

310.title: Russia has barely started its action: President Putin to Ukraine
310.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday warned the Ukrainian government that Russia has barely started its action in Ukraine. Putin said, "We have heard many times that the West wants to fight us to the last Ukrainian." "This is a tragedy for the Ukrainian people, but it seems that everything is heading towards this," he added.

311.title: I work to keep myself busy, I don't need money: Neetu Kapoor
311.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor stated in an interview that she is working to keep herself busy and happy, adding that she doesn't need money. "At this age, I don't need to be famous...The time when I wanted things has passed," she added. The actress further said that she enjoys talking to media persons and journalists and even remembers their names now.

312.title: Common man should get priority over VIPs: Maha CM to police
312.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday instructed the police that his convoy does not require a special protocol and asked them not to hold up traffic for his convoy across the state. "This is a government of the common man so he should get priority over VIPs," Shinde said. It causes traffic snarls and burdens the police force, he added.

313.title: Difficult to believe that Japan's ex-PM Abe is no more: Prez Kovind
313.article_body: Expressing grief over the assassination of ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "I find it difficult to believe that...Abe is no more." "He was a great statesman, & his infectious affability endeared him the world over," he added. "That he fell prey to an assassin's bullet is a tragedy for the whole humanity," he further said.

314.title: Dare TMC to arrest me: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on remarks on WB CM
314.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh dared the TMC government to arrest him for his comments on Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. "TMC is falling on the feet of the governor so that I can be arrested. They are shameless!" Ghosh tweeted. Ghosh's comment comes after a TMC delegation met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and sought action against him.

315.title: Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy: Deputy CM Fadnavis
315.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that "Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy". He said, "We made...pledge in 2015 to grow to a trillion-dollar economy by 2030. I renew that pledge today under Maharashtra's CM Eknath Shinde's leadership." "If we keep progressing as a nation, we can become a seven trillion economy," he added.

316.title: 19-year-old man feared drowned in river in Thane's Bhiwandi
316.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Mohammad Asif, was feared drowned in a river in Thane's Bhiwandi on Friday, an official from the fire brigade said. "The incident took place at Bhiwandi's Kamwari river...around 1 pm when the victim...had ventured into the water for a swim along with four others," the official said. Asif was swept away by strong currents, he added.

317.title: Redmi K50i 5G outscores iPhone 13 in AnTuTu benchmark score: Redmi India
317.article_body: Redmi India announced today that its upcoming smartphone, Redmi K50i 5G has outscored iPhone 13 in AnTuTu scores. The brand tweeted its benchmark score of 8,22,274 points, as compared to 7,82,653 points scored by iPhone 13's A15 chipset (4-core). The smartphone is reportedly powered by the flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 and will be launched in India on July 20.

318.title: Man dies by suicide inside washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi: Reports
318.article_body: A man in his 40s allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi's Vikaspuri on Friday, as per reports. An Aadhaar card was found in the pocket of the deceased, on the basis of which he was identified. So far, the reason behind the suicide has not been ascertained, reports further stated.

319.title: Cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 5, video shows tents coming under flash floods
319.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu & Kashmir. Some tents have come under flash floods and five deaths have been reported. Rescue operation is in progress and the injured are being airlifted for treatment. The situation is under control, said IGP Kashmir, Vijay Kumar.

320.title: India's Prannoy beats world no. 14 Tsuneyama to enter Malaysia Masters semis
320.article_body: India's HS Prannoy entered the semi-final of Malaysia Masters 2022 after beating world number 14 Kanta Tsuneyama 25-23, 22-20 on Friday. The 29-year-old won the quarter-final match in one hour. Unseeded Prannoy, who is the only Indian left in the tournament, will face eighth seeded Ng Ka Long Angus. Hong Kong's Long Angus defeated Chou Tien Chen 13-21, 21-12, 21-13.

321.title: Ashneer Grover and his wife incorporate new company called 'Third Unicorn'
321.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain have incorporated a new company named 'Third Unicorn Private Limited'. The company was incorporated on July 6 and lists Ashneer and Madhuri as Directors. Madhuri was previously the Head of Controls at BharatPe. On his 40th birthday last month, Ashneer had tweeted, "Time to disrupt another sector. It's time for...Third Unicorn."

322.title: Krawczyk and Skupski win 2nd straight mixed doubles title at Wimbledon
322.article_body: Number two seeds Desirae Krawczyk and Neal Skupski won their second straight mixed doubles Wimbledon title by defeating Australia's Sam Stosur and Matt Ebden 6-4, 6-3 in the final on Thursday. Notably, the British-American duo became the first pair to defend a mixed doubles title since Czech brother-sister duo Cyril Suk and Helena Sukova in 1997.

323.title: Who are the 5 Indian-Americans on Forbes list of richest self-made women in US?
323.article_body: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, is the richest Indian-American on Forbes list of America's richest self-made women with $1.9 billion net worth. The list features Syntel Co-founder Neerja Sethi and Confluent Co-founder Neha Narkhede with $1 billion and $490 million fortune, respectively. PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi, who's worth $320 million, is the 4th richest Indian-American on the list.

324.title: Cyber crimes against India initiated by 2 hacker groups after Nupur Sharma incident
324.article_body: In the aftermath of Nupur Sharma incident, two hacker groups namely 'DragonForce Malaysia' and 'Hacktivist Indonesia' initiated a cyber war against India, said Amit Vasava, DCP, Cyber Crime, Ahmedabad. "Over two thousand websites were hacked...Ahmedabad Cyber Crime has written to Malaysian and Indonesian governments along with writing to Interpol for lookout notice for both groups," Vasava added.

325.title: 7 MP college students fined for chanting Hanuman Chalisa; minister orders probe
325.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said that no fine will be imposed on the seven students of Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) in Bhopal for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. "If Hanuman Chalisa is not chanted in Hindustan, then where?" he added. Mishra further said that he has asked the District Collector to probe the matter.

326.title: Actor Vikram did not have cardiac arrest, doctors confirm
326.article_body: After Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised, his doctors confirmed in a statement that he did not suffer cardiac arrest and is clinically stable. It further stated that the actor will be discharged from the hospital soon. Vikram was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday after complaining of discomfort in his chest. His publicist said that he had high fever.

327.title: Ram Charan & I don't want children for population control: Upasana
327.article_body: Actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela said that the couple does not want to have children for population control. She further said the 'RRR' in her life stands for relationship, reproduction and role in life. Earlier, Ram Charan spoke about it, saying he has the responsibility of making fans happy and having children will deviate him from his mission.

328.title: Pained to learn about assassination of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe: Shah
328.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday expressed grief over the assassination of former PM of Japan, Shinzo Abe. Taking to Twitter, Shah said, "Pained to learn about the assassination of...India's valued friend, Shinzo Abe. His efforts in strengthening...India-Japan relationship will always be held fondly in our memories." "My deepest condolences to his family...and...people of Japan," he added.

330.title: ED summons Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
330.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday issued summons to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain to appear before it at its headquarters for questioning on July 14 in connection with a money laundering case. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

331.title: That's snake sh*t: Doja on Noah sharing private chat about Joseph
331.article_body: Singer Doja Cat criticised actor Noah Schnapp in an Instagram Live session for sharing their private chat about actor Joseph Quinn in a TikTok post. She said, "[It's] so unbelievably like socially unaware and wack...that's like borderline snake sh*t, that's like weasel sh*t." Doja further said that when people are young, they do "dumb sh*t" and "f*ck up relationships".

332.title: TCS Q1 profit rises 5.21% y-o-y to ₹9,478 cr, revenue at ₹52,758 cr
332.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reported a 5.21% rise in its net profit at ₹9,478 crore for the April-June quarter of FY23, compared to ₹9,008 crore from the same quarter a year ago. The company's revenue rose by 16.2% year-on-year to ₹52,758 crore. TCS has also declared an interim dividend of ₹8 per share.

333.title: Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case
333.article_body: Steve Bannon, talk show host and former White House advisor to former President Donald Trump, looks on as he leaves an appearance in U.S. District Court in Washington, U.S., November 15, 2021. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case.

334.title: India goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu marries longtime girlfriend Devenish, shares pic
334.article_body: Indian men's football team goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu married his longtime girlfriend Devenish Singh. Sharing a picture from the wedding on social media, he wrote, "Signed the most important contract of my life. Our lives, now. The thought of spending the rest of our days together ends up making everyday after this one, the happiest of our lives."

335.title: I don't have any idea what it is, don't really like that silly term: McCullum on 'Bazball'
335.article_body: Talking about the term 'Bazball' used to describe England's attacking style in Test cricket, England head coach Brendon McCullum, who is nicknamed Baz, said, "I don't have any idea what Bazball is." He added, "I don't really like that silly term...because there's actually quite a bit of thought that goes into how the guys manufacture their performances."

336.title: Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan to remain a playground: Cong MLA
336.article_body: Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan on Friday said that the Idgah Maidan in Chamarajpet locality of Bengaluru will remain a playground forever. "Everyone demanded that the playground must be preserved. Where has the playground gone? Who has tried to remove it? Whether MLA, BBMP or Wakf Board have stated that the playground will cease to exist here?" Zameer questioned.

337.title: Beating Novak in Slam not easy: Murray on Norrie's chances in Wimbledon semis
337.article_body: Talking about compatriot Cameron Norrie's chances against three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic in the semi-final at Wimbledon, Great Britain's Andy Murray said it's going to be an "unbelievably difficult challenge" for the ninth seed. "To beat someone like Novak in a Slam is not easy, but Cam [Norrie] is playing well and he'll be confident," he added.

338.title: Saddened to know about demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Kejriwal
338.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed condolences and said he is saddened to know about the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "The world has lost a great leader. May the departed soul rest in peace," Kejriwal tweeted. Shinzo Abe was shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara.

339.title: Articles call 'Dhaakad' flop, no one talks about 'Radhe Shyam', '83': Kangana
339.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently wrote on Instagram Stories that hundreds of articles are calling 'Dhaakad' a flop. She shared a screenshot of an article calling 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', '83', 'Radhe Shyam' and 'JugJugg Jeeyo' flops, writing, "No one is talking about these big disasters...any specific reason?" Kangana wrote in another story that the negative PR for 'Dhaakad' has not stopped.

340.title: Sindhu loses to Tai Tzu for 2nd time in 2 weeks at Malaysia Masters
340.article_body: Ex-world champion PV Sindhu crashed out of Malaysia Masters 2022 after losing to Tai Tzu Ying 13-21, 21-12, 12-21 in the quarter-final on Friday. This was seventh seeded Sindhu's seventh straight loss to second seeded Tai Tzu and 17th defeat in 22 matches. Notably, Sindhu lost to Tai Tzu in the quarter-final at Malaysia Open last week.

341.title: Thieves cut hole in wall, steal jewellery worth ₹65 lakh from shop in Guj
341.article_body: Police said a jewellery showroom in Gujarat's Vapi was robbed of gold ornaments worth ₹65.94 lakh on Thursday night after thieves entered by cutting a hole in a wall. It was a planned robbery as the thieves allegedly rented a shop sharing a wall with the showroom, police added. All the jewellery items that were on display were reportedly missing.

342.title: No one can take away Sena's 'bow & arrow' symbol: Uddhav Thackeray
342.article_body: Maharashtra's former CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said the 'bow and arrow' symbol will always remain with the party. "There's a discussion going on about the party's symbol. As per the law, no one can take away 'bow and arrow' from Shiv Sena," he added. Thackeray further demanded that mid-term elections should be held in Maharashtra.

343.title: 2 unidentified men attempt to break into ATMs in Thane, case filed
343.article_body: Police on Thursday said two unidentified persons allegedly attempted to break into two ATMs in Thane's Bhiwandi. The accused tried to open the machines using a screwdriver to remove cash, police said, adding both the machines were damaged. A case has been registered under IPC sections 380 (theft), 511 (attempt to commit offence) and 427 (mischief causing damage), they added.

344.title: Bengaluru Police raid fake call centre in Whitefield, 6 detained
344.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Friday detained six people and seized items worth ₹2 crore during a raid on a fake call centre in Whitefield. The seized items include 127 desktops, four laptops, 10 internal hard disks, six iPhones, three luxury cars and ₹18 lakh in cash. The company running the call centre was involved in cybercrimes, according to the police.

345.title: Man robbed of ₹8,000 in Hyderabad, 2 accused held within 24 hours
345.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested two men for allegedly robbing a man of ₹8,000 within 24 hours of the crime. Police said the accused Bommenna Srikar and Vagmera Vijay Kumar approached Mohd Shahzad, pretending to seek directions, while he was on his way home after withdrawing money from an ATM. Police also recovered a two-wheeler and two mobile phones from them.

346.title: GHMC to set up 2 more construction & debris plants in Hyderabad
346.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) announced setting up of two construction and debris waste management plants at Charminar and Secunderabad zones. The civic body has come up with the initiative to prevent construction debris from being discharged in lakes and on footpaths. The GHMC has invited tenders to set up plants within a 10 km distance in the city.

347.title: Waiting for divorce from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP: SBSP chief
347.article_body: Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Friday said he will not initiate any steps to break SBSP's alliance with the Samajwadi Party and that he is waiting for "talaq" (divorce) from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP. Rajbhar added that he is "still with the SP, but will not remain together forcefully if Akhilesh Yadav doesn't want it".

348.title: Andhra CM Reddy's mother quits YSR Cong Party to support daughter in T'gana
348.article_body: YS Vijayamma, mother of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, on Friday resigned as the honorary president of the ruling YSR Congress Party. Vijayamma said she will now support her daughter YS Sharmila, who is heading the YSR Telangana Party in the neighbouring state. "My daughter is fighting alone. If I don’t support her, it'll be injustice," Vijayamma added.

349.title: IAS officer, arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after party in J'khand, suspended
349.article_body: The Jharkhand government on Friday suspended IAS officer Sayyed Riyaj Ahemad, who was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student.
