Ahemad was arrested on Tuesday and sent to judicial custody for two weeks after the engineering student filed a police complaint. He allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence.

350.title: 4 minors blackmail and rape 15-yr-old female classmate in TN; arrested
350.article_body: Four minors were arrested in Tamil Nadu for allegedly raping their 15-year-old female classmate after blackmailing her over attending a function without her parents' knowledge. The accused had allegedly taken photos of the girl with a boy, whose birthday party she was attending. They allegedly took her to one of their homes, raped her and filmed the act, police said.

351.title: Apple's Steve Jobs awarded US' highest civilian honour posthumously
351.article_body: US President Joe Biden presented the Presidential Medal of Freedom, US' highest civilian honour, to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs on Thursday. His wife, Laurene Powell Jobs, accepted the award on his behalf. "His (Jobs') vision, imagination and creativity led to inventions that have, and continue to, change the way the world communicates," the White House earlier said.

352.title: Teakwood smuggling racket busted in MP's Indore
352.article_body: Forest officers have busted a teakwood smuggling racket in Indore. The accused would smuggle the teakwood from the forests and send it to the Narmada river by boat. For the past six months, the forest officials have taken more than half a dozen actions to curb teakwood smuggling. Choral range has been a hotspot for timber smugglers.

353.title: He was a friend of India: Sitharaman on demise of Japan's ex-PM Abe
353.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has expressed grief over the demise of former PM of Japan Shinzo Abe. In a tweet on Friday, Sitharaman said, "Express my profound grief on the tragic demise of...Shinzo Abe. He was a friend of India and we held him in great regard." Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Japan's Nara city.

354.title: Akshay was upset, felt he got a raw deal: Shabbir Boxwala on 'Mohra'
354.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala, while talking about his film 'Mohra', said Akshay Kumar was upset with the film's title. "He felt that the title was biased towards Suniel and...he got a raw deal. However, we reasoned that he had an equally important role," Shabbir added. "Through...song, 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast', the...money he made is mind-boggling," Shabbir further said.

355.title: Kohli should open the batting if he plays in 2nd T20I vs England: Swann
355.article_body: Graeme Swann has said if Virat Kohli returns to India's playing XI in second T20I against England then he should open innings with captain Rohit Sharma. "When you've got a player as good as Virat, you don't want him batting at number three in...middle overs because he isn't going to score as quickly as...Suryakumar Yadav or Deepak Hooda," he added.

356.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX running anti-5G narrative, says US non-profit
356.article_body: US non-profit '5G for 12 GHz Coalition' has accused Elon Musk's SpaceX of initiating a "public misinformation campaign" against 5G. It said that SpaceX lied to customers about how expanding certain airwaves for 5G could disrupt its Starlink satellite internet service. "This tactic, which is commonly used by Musk...promulgates an anti-5G narrative that is harmful to American consumers," it added.

357.title: ED fines Amnesty India ₹51 cr, ex-CEO Aakar Patel ₹10 cr for FEMA violations
357.article_body: Amnesty India International Pvt Ltd and its former CEO Aakar Patel have been fined ₹51.72 crore and ₹10 crore, respectively, the Directorate of Enforcement (ED) said on Friday. The ED added that its Adjudicating Authority has adjudicated a show cause notice to Amnesty India and Patel for contravention of the provisions of FEMA (Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999).

358.title: Steve Smith smashes an international hundred for the first time in 18 months
358.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith on Friday smashed his first hundred in international cricket in 18 months. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 193 deliveries in the first innings of the second Test against Sri Lanka. Steve Smith has now hit 28 hundreds in Test cricket. Smith has hit five Test hundreds in Asia.

359.title: Great player, superb leader: Harbhajan to Ganguly on his 50th birthday
359.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to wish Sourav Ganguly on his 50th birthday on Friday. "A great player, a superb leader, the BCCI President and my captain...Dada have a wonderful year ahead. Love always!" he wrote. Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Happy Birthday Dada! You've been a great friend, an impactful captain and a senior any youngster would want to learn from."

360.title: Campus Fund raises ₹75 crore to invest in student-led startups
360.article_body: Campus Fund, which invests in student-led startups, announced that it has raised ₹75 crore for its second fund. IIFL Wealth, Omidyar Network India and ex-Chairman of HDFC Securities Bharat Shah were among those who participated in the round. Campus Fund was launched in July 2020. Its first fund had a corpus of ₹7 crore which was invested across 10 startups.

361.title: 12-yr-old girl kidnapped, raped on way home from school in Jharkhand
361.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two men in Jharkhand's Dumka. She was going home from school to collect a notebook that she had forgotten to carry. The accused, who were in a car, asked her about a river and when she stopped to reply, they abducted her, raped her and dumped her in Godda, the girl told police.

362.title: Bihar man enters classroom with sword after child denied money for uniform
362.article_body: A man in Bihar's Araria district allegedly barged into a school with a sword and threatened teachers after he didn't get money for his child's school uniform, police said. The man also told the teachers that he would return if he did not get the money within 24 hours. An FIR has been registered against the man following the incident.

363.title: Philippine President in isolation after testing +ve for coronavirus
363.article_body: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr is in isolation after testing positive for coronavirus in an antigen test, his spokeswoman said on Friday. People who came into contact with the President, including his son, have tested negative for COVID-19, the spokeswoman added. Notably, this comes after Marcos Jr's meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Wednesday.

364.title: Meta virtual reality headsets to no longer require Facebook for login
364.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta said that it'll no longer require people to sign in to their Facebook accounts to use its virtual reality headsets. CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced a new virtual reality login system that will be launched in August 2022. The users will now be required to create a Meta account as well as a social profile, Meta Horizon.

365.title: Expecting Indian boxers to win 4 golds at CWG 2022: Nikhat Zareen
365.article_body: Newly-crowned world boxing champion Nikhat Zareen has said that she is expecting Indian boxers to win four gold medals in this month's Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. "I expect at least eight medals, of which I will take four gold [for Indian] boxers. Let's see what happens...We have World Championship medallists and Olympians," the 26-year-old boxer said.

366.title: I've smashed sixes all my life but now I feel happier hitting a four: Hardik
366.article_body: Hardik Pandya said he has smashed sixes all his life but now "feels happier" after hitting a four, adding it touches his heart. Hardik smashed 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England which comprised six fours and a six. Discussing his bowling, Hardik stated, "I was happier seeing 90.5 mph on the speedometer than my overall performance."

367.title: I'm not going to plan it: Ms Marvel's Iman on future Hollywood plans
367.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, who plays the titular role in 'Ms Marvel', said that she is not going to plan her future in Hollywood. "I didn't even know I could do this. 'Ms Marvel' came out of nowhere...I'm just going to see where life takes me," she added. The actress further said that she is just going with the flow.

368.title: 'Thor: Love...' earns ₹18.6 cr on day 1, more than Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2, Prithviraj
368.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earned ₹18.60 crore on day one of release in India, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh said. Hindi films such as 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' opened at ₹14.1 crore and ₹10.7 crore, respectively. The film, starring Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale, has been released in English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam in India.

369.title: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 bn to hacks this yr: Report
369.article_body: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 billion to hacks and exploits in the first half of 2022, more than all of 2021 combined, blockchain auditing and security company CertiK reported. About $308 million was lost across 27 flash loan attacks in the June quarter, while $14 million was lost to flash loans in Q1.

370.title: 25 students rescued after T'gana school bus gets submerged in floodwater
370.article_body: At least 25 school students were rescued by local residents after a bus carrying them got submerged in floodwater in Telangana's Mahabubnagar district on Friday. The bus of a private school was passing under a railway bridge when it got stuck midway. After the rescue of the children, the bus was reportedly pulled out with the help of a tractor.

371.title: When India bowls, Rohit as skipper makes huge impression: Jaffer
371.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that limited-overs skipper Rohit Sharma makes a "huge impression" as captain when India is "bowling". "The changes that he [Rohit] makes and the calls that he takes, that makes a huge difference," Jaffer said. "What we've seen of Arshdeep Singh [in the first T20I], I would have given him another game," Jaffer added.

372.title: Volkswagen, partners to invest $20 billion to produce EV batteries
372.article_body: German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen said the company along with its partners will invest over $20 billion to produce electric vehicle (EV) batteries. This will result in the creation of 20,000 jobs and annual sales of above $20 billion by 2030, it added. The announcement was made at the groundbreaking ceremony of the company's first battery plant in Europe.

373.title: PMC to hire pvt agency for mechanical cleaning of Pune's public toilets
373.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to hire a private agency to clean the city's public toilets using machines. Earlier, the cleaning of toilets was managed by the PMC staff but now it will be handled by an agency for five years, officials said. "The contractor will be responsible for toilets' cleaning, water supply, proper functioning of doors," an official said.

374.title: It doesn't bother me: Nikki on being trolled for crying on Moosewala's death
374.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has opened up about being trolled for crying at the airport post Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death. "I was very sad when I heard about his death and...broke into tears. It was a natural reaction," Nikki said. "Whether I laugh or cry, I still get trolled, it doesn't bother me now," she added.

375.title: 'Oo Antava' hotter than 'Tip Tip', but Katrina is a better dancer: Ranveer
375.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, during the rapid-fire round on 'Koffee With Karan season 7', said that Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Oo Antava' was hotter than Katrina Kaif's 'Tip Tip'. "I think that's (Oo Antava) the hotter song. So, I prefer that as a song and I prefer the choreography," he said. Ranveer, however, added that Katrina is a better dancer.

376.title: The ball kept sailing over our heads: Russel on Dhoni's 183* vs SL
376.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's 183* against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said, "Sachin Tendulkar was out in the first over and Virender Sehwag was out early too, but then India sprung a surprise." "Dhoni came and quietly took control...The...buzz we had...started disappearing...The ball kept sailing over [our] heads...Each time he hit the ball, it went...further away," he added.

377.title: MCD identifies over 200 houses as unsafe amid monsoon rains in Delhi
377.article_body: NDMC and the MCD surveyed over 26 lakh properties in Delhi to identify hazardous structures that could collapse during the rainy season and ensure their destruction or rehabilitation. Out of over 26 lakh properties surveyed, 266 houses in Delhi were deemed unsafe and owners were given notices, an official said. Reportedly, North Delhi had the maximum number of dangerous buildings.

378.title: Pune civic body to allocate space for organic food stalls in markets
378.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to allocate space for organic food stalls in the city's marketplaces. The decision has been taken in view of the state government's 'Urban Food System' scheme. "The agriculture companies or groups of farmers can apply...in the PMC...The farmers will have to get their products to market at their own cost," an official said.

379.title: Cut edible oil prices by ₹15 per litre immediately: Govt to edible oil associations
379.article_body: The government has directed leading edible oil associations to cut prices of edible oils by ₹15 per litre with immediate effect. The Centre has advised manufacturers and refiners to reduce the price of oils to distributors. "Whenever a reduction in price to distributors is made by...manufactures or refiners, the benefit should be passed on to the consumers," the government said.

380.title: 'Friends' co-creator apologizes for misgendering Chandler's trans parent
380.article_body: Marta Kauffman, co-creator of American TV show 'Friends', has apologised for misgendering character Chandler Bing's transgender parent, Charles Bing, in the show. Kauffman told Fox News, "Pronouns weren't yet something that I understood. So...we didn't refer to that character as 'she'." "That was a mistake," Kauffman said, adding she regrets referring to Charles as Chandler's father.

381.title: Chilean hockey player proposes to boyfriend after scoring in women's WC, video viral
381.article_body: Chilean hockey player Francisca Tala proposed to her boyfriend after scoring a goal in her team's women's hockey World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands. "I made a bet with the girls that if I made a goal against the Netherlands, I had to marry my boyfriend," she said. Chile have reached the cross-over round in the ongoing World Cup.

382.title: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
382.article_body: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.

383.title: Russian bank reusing bank card chips to combat shortage amid Ukraine war
383.article_body: Russian bank SberBank has started reusing chips from un-activated bank cards to combat a shortage resulting from European suppliers halting deliveries amid the Ukraine war. "A shortage of chips for cards has started in Russia. We mostly worked with European chip producers...there is now a big problem with logistics from Europe," SberBank's head of cyber compliance Olga Maklashina said.

384.title: Jacqueline to play actress Priya Rajvansh in director Pradeep Sarkar's next
384.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez will play the role of actress Priya Rajvansh in her and filmmaker Chetan Anand's biopic. The film will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar and produced by Deepak Mukut. Notably, Priya Rajvansh worked exclusively for Chetan Anand and had starred in films including 'Haqeeqat', 'Heer Raanjha' and 'Hanste Zakhm'. She died on March 27, 2000.

385.title: Alia wishes Neetu Kapoor on her b'day, shares pic from her haldi ceremony
385.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to share a post marking Neetu Kapoor's birthday. Sharing a picture from her haldi ceremony, Alia wrote, "Happiest birthday to the most beautiful soul...My mother-in-law/friend/soon-to-be dadi maaaaa...love you so so much!" Neetu turned 64 on Friday. Alia is expecting her first child with her husband, actor Ranbir Kapoor.

386.title: Who is Indian-origin Suella Braverman, who said she seeks to be UK's next PM?
386.article_body: Indian-origin UK MP Suella Braverman has publicly announced that she intends to seek the position of UK's Prime Minister after Boris Johnson's resignation. The 42-year-old is the UK's second female Attorney General who was appointed as the country's top legal official in February 2020. Braverman has studied Law at Queens' College, Cambridge and was called to the Bar in 2005.

387.title: Russia threatens to 'take back' Alaska from US
387.article_body: The Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, has threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets as punishment for its invasion of Ukraine. Russia colonised Alaska and established several settlements there until the US purchased it from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million.

388.title: Actor Vikram admitted to hospital, team refutes reports of heart attack
388.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised on Friday and his publicist confirmed that the actor was taken to hospital after he complained of discomfort due to high fever symptoms. Contrary to some reports that claimed that Vikram suffered a heart attack and was therefore admitted to the hospital, his publicist said it was high fever and he's doing fine.

389.title: India lost a close friend today: Rajnath on ex-Japan PM Abe's assassination
389.article_body: Expressing grief over former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination on Friday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "India today has lost a close friend who assiduously worked towards strengthening bilateral relations." "I met with Mr Abe...in 2019. I found him to be an inspiring leader who had the vision to create a safe and better world," Singh added.

390.title: He could play for another 10 years: Finch on 35-yr-old David Warner
390.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said 35-year-old Australian batter David Warner could play for another 10 years considering his fitness. "He loves the competition and [continues] to challenge himself," added Finch. "I can't believe people wrote Warner off...It was almost like poking the bear," Finch had said after Australia's triumph in the men's T20 World Cup 2021.

391.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav's health is improving: Daughter Misa Bharti
391.article_body: RJD leader Misa Bharti tweeted that the health of her father Lalu Prasad Yadav is improving. She also shared some photos of the RJD chief from hospital and wrote, "Lalu Ji's condition is much better...because of his morale and your prayers. Please don't pay attention to rumours." Lalu was hospitalised with severe injuries and airlifted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday.

392.title: ED raids 18 places linked to J'khand CM Soren's close aide over tender scam
392.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday conducted raids at 18 locations in Jharkhand as part of a money-laundering investigation against MLA Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, officials said. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged scam carried out while availing marketplace tender in Sahibganj's Barharwa in 2020.

393.title: Pics of late actor James Caan with Pacino from The Godfather's premiere go viral
393.article_body: Following the demise of James Caan, the late actor's pictures from the premiere of 'The Godfather' in 1972 have gone viral on social media. In the pictures, Caan can be seen interacting with Al Pacino and Ali MacGraw. The actor passed away aged 82. Mourning his demise, Pacino said, "Hard to believe that he won't be in the world anymore."

394.title: Hazlewood's IPL stint with CSK helped his T20 game: Aaron Finch
394.article_body: Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that pacer Josh Hazlewood's stint with Chennai Super Kings improved his T20 game. "For such a long time Hazlewood's focus was just on Test cricket...I think he got that in the lead-up to the last T20 World Cup while playing all 14 games for CSK," Finch said.

395.title: On-duty ITBP officer shoots himself dead in J&K's Poonch
395.article_body: An on-duty ITBP officer posted in J&K shot himself dead with his service weapon on Friday, officials said. The deceased personnel has been identified as Assistant Sub-Inspector Prem Chand, officials added. The incident took place at the Mini Secretariat in Poonch town, according to officials. They further informed that Chand was taken to the hospital where he was declared dead.

396.title: PCMC launches WhatsApp Chatbot to resolve public grievances in 6hrs
396.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has launched 'WhatsApp Chatbot' to address the public grievances related to civic services like waste collection and sewage accumulation. Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane said the administration will try to resolve the complaints in six hours. Reportedly, PCMC resolved more than 500 complaints via WhatsApp Chatbot in a single day.

397.title: 27-yr-old man held for opening fire at a person at gym in Delhi
397.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been arrested for opening fire at a person at a gym in Delhi's Patel Nagar area, police said. The incident took place after the victim had an argument with the man's girlfriend a few days ago, police added. The victim received a gunshot injury in the stomach and was rushed to a hospital, police further said.

398.title: Tesla sells record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June
398.article_body: Tesla sold record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June, including 968 for export, the China Passenger Car Association said. The automaker sold 32,165 vehicles and exported 22,340 in May. The overall passenger car sales in China in June totalled 1.97 million, up 22% from a year earlier. Out of the total sales, electric cars accounted for 27%.

399.title: North Korean hackers targeting US hospitals with Maui ransomware: US
399.article_body: The US government agencies, in an advisory, said that North Korean government-sponsored cyber hackers have used a ransomware, known as Maui, since May 2021 to target US health organisations. According to cybersecurity firm Chainalysis, these hackers made at least $731 million in 2021. The advisory noted that the ransomware disrupted the healthcare services "for prolonged periods".

400.title: Deeply saddened by demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Rahul
400.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed condolences and said that he's "deeply saddened" by the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "[Abe's] role in strengthening...strategic relationship between India and Japan was commendable," he added. He further said that Abe has left behind a "lasting legacy in...Indo-Pacific". Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Nara city.

401.title: Even in Australia, spin will play big part in T20 WC 2022: Finch
401.article_body: Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch has said that spin bowling will play a big part, especially in the middle overs, during this year's ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Spin is always going to have an impact...especially on bigger grounds in Australia. Here you have got to hit it in a way to get it to the boundary," Finch said.

402.title: Edtech platform Gurusiksha raises ₹50 lakh in its 1st funding round
402.article_body: Online tutoring and mentoring platform Gurusiksha has secured ₹50 lakh from angel investors in its first funding round. The startup plans to raise another funding round later this year. The newly-raised funds will be deployed for purposes like business expansion and adding more courses, the company said. Founded in 2016 by Dipak Jha, Gurusiksha claims to operate across India.

403.title: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
403.article_body: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.
